alert.note: Alert for Charlton; Clinch; Echols; Ware (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 7:04PM EDT until July 30 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Baker County in northeastern Florida... Northeastern Columbia County in northern Florida... Hamilton County in northern Florida... Echols County in southeastern Georgia... Southeastern Ware County in southeastern Georgia... Southern Clinch County in southeastern Georgia... Southeastern Charlton County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 704 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jennings to near St. George, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jasper, Jennings, Fargo, Statenville, Taylor, Mayday, Needmore, St. George, Belmont and Blue Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
